name: Idiopathic Laryngeal Neuropathic Syndrome (ILNS)
chief_complaint: I feel like there's something stuck in my throat all the time, and it burns when I talk.
physical_findings: Intermittent adductor laryngeal dystonia observed on laryngoscopy

lab_results.Laryngeal EMG: Increased spontaneous activity in thyroarytenoid muscles

treatment: Laryngeal botulinum toxin injections for refractory cases
Cognitive behavioral therapy for sensory hypersensitivity component
prognosis: Variable; 60% achieve significant symptom control with multimodal therapy, but condition may wax and wane. Complete remission is rare.
description: A recently characterized neuropathic disorder of the laryngeal sensory nerves causing chronic dysesthesia and motor dysfunction. Thought to involve small fiber neuropathy of the superior laryngeal nerve branches with central sensitization. Distinct from typical laryngopharyngeal reflux or muscle tension dysphonia.
risk_factors: Previous neck trauma or intubation injury
